page.title: 03THE HURTWOOD
page.content: The Hurtwood is an area of some 4,000 acres of privately-owned forest,around the villages of Peaslake,Shere and Holmbury St.Mary.The public has right of access 'for air and exercise'. The forest is administered by The Hurtwood Control, a voluntary organisation, created in 1925.Its functions include maintaining paths and bridleways, clearing litter and watching for outbreaks of fire. Horse-riding is permitted but motor vehicles are not allowed on the Hurtwood.Trees may not be cut down or wood removed by the public. No litter is to be deposited or rubbish dumped and no camping or caravan parking is allowed without prior permission. The main landowners are the Bray Estate and the Albury Park Estate. Both are engaged in commercial forestry, producing Scotch Pine.
